description: A government judicial island with a massive waterfall that leads into a mysterious void, known for never experiencing nighttime.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Jumps Towards the Falls
keyEvents.description: Luffy jumps towards the massive waterfall at Enies Lobby, demonstrating his determination to rescue Robin regardless of the danger.
keyEvents.significance: This moment in the present timeline frames the entire recap episode, showing Luffy's current resolve before flashing back to how Shanks inspired it.

statusHistory.reason: Location is active during the Enies Lobby Arc

description: A peaceful village in the East Blue on Dawn Island where Luffy was born and raised, and where he first met Shanks.

keyEvents.title: Flashback to Luffy's Childhood
keyEvents.description: The episode flashes back to young Luffy's time in Foosha Village with Shanks and the Red Hair Pirates.
keyEvents.significance: This flashback provides the emotional foundation for understanding Luffy's current determination during the Enies Lobby arc.

keyEvents.title: Shanks Gives Luffy the Straw Hat
keyEvents.description: Shanks entrusts his treasured straw hat to young Luffy before departing the village.
keyEvents.significance: This moment establishes the core promise and symbol of the entire One Piece series.

description: A bar in Foosha Village run by Makino, frequented by Shanks and his crew during their stay in the village.

keyEvents.title: Higuma Confronts Shanks
keyEvents.description: The mountain bandit Higuma insults and provokes Shanks at Partys Bar, pouring alcohol on him, but Shanks refuses to fight.
keyEvents.significance: This scene teaches Luffy an important lesson about choosing when to fight and demonstrates Shanks' wisdom and restraint.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Defends Shanks
keyEvents.description: Young Luffy stands up to Higuma to defend Shanks' honor, showing his early courage and loyalty.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's core character traits that will define him as a pirate captain.

statusHistory.reason: Bar continues to operate in Foosha Village

description: The coastal area near Foosha Village where Shanks saved Luffy from the Lord of the Coast and lost his arm.

keyEvents.title: Higuma Kidnaps Luffy
keyEvents.description: Higuma takes young Luffy out to sea and throws him into the ocean, leaving him to drown.
keyEvents.significance: This cruel act sets up the most important moment in Luffy's childhood - Shanks' sacrifice.

keyEvents.title: Lord of the Coast Eats Higuma
keyEvents.description: The massive Sea King known as the Lord of the Coast emerges and devours Higuma and his boat.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the deadly dangers of the sea and sets up the immediate threat to Luffy.

keyEvents.title: Shanks Saves Luffy and Loses His Arm
keyEvents.description: Shanks rescues Luffy from the Lord of the Coast but loses his left arm in the process, then uses Conqueror's Haki to scare away the creature.
keyEvents.significance: One of the most pivotal moments in One Piece, establishing the depth of Shanks' care for Luffy and becoming the catalyst for Luffy's entire journey.

keyEvents.title: Shanks Uses Conqueror's Haki
keyEvents.description: Shanks unleashes his Conqueror's Haki to drive away the Lord of the Coast.
keyEvents.significance: One of the earliest displays of Haki in the series, though not explained at this point in the story.
